revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory|action1=WAR |action1date=23 January 2011 |action1link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Minas Geraes-class battleship |action1result=approved |action1oldid=409266781 |maindate= 10 September 2015 |action2=FAC |action2date=18:42, 12 February 2011 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Minas Geraes-class battleship/archive1 |action2result=promoted |action2oldid=413251137 |action3=FTC |action3date=15:10, 11 October 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Minas Geraes-class battleships/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action4=FTC |action4date=03:20, 22 August 2012 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/South American dreadnought race/archive1 |action4result=promoted |ftname=Minas Geraes-class battleships |ftmain=yes |ft2name=South American dreadnought race |currentstatus=FA }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA|A-Class=pass|Maritime=yes|South-American=yes|OMT=1 | B1 = y | B2 = y | B3 = y | B4 = y | B5 = y }} {{WikiProject Brazil|class=FA|importance=low|history=yes}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA|B1=yes|B2=yes|B3=yes|B4=yes|B5=yes}} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2011-04-17|oldid1=424597631|date2=2012-04-17|oldid2=487918371}} == Note on "Minas Geraes I" == The link to the ship's history as given on [http://biblioteca.dphdm.mar.mil.br/internet/navios/Index.asp?codNavio=368 the linked reference] is wrong; it is actually located [http://biblioteca.dphdm.mar.mil.br/internet/navios/Documentos\MINAS_GERAIS_I.DOC here] in the .doc format. [[User:The ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]] 07:01, 19 August 2011 (UTC) == Coal-firing == The statement: "However, unlike Dreadnought, which had turbines, they were powered by reciprocating engines with coal-fired boilers." Creates the impression that ''Dreadnought'' did not have coal-fired boilers, which was not the case. [[Special:Contributions/167.127.24.33|167.127.24.33]] ([[User talk:167.127.24.33|talk]]) 16:21, 18 June 2008 (UTC)daniel == Brasseys 1923 diagrams == Great diagrams! Can anyone access the same source to get those for the "Rivadavia" class? So both classes could be better compared. Thanks, [[User:DPdH|DPdH]] ([[User talk:DPdH|talk]]) 10:04, 20 March 2009 (UTC) == Wrong Name == The correct name of this Ship should be Minas Gerais, like the brasilian state, and not Minas Geraes. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/189.109.51.78|189.109.51.78]] ([[User talk:189.109.51.78|talk]]) 11:09, 11 January 2011 (UTC) :This is explained in the article under footnote 2. Regards, [[User:The ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]] 05:59, 21 May 2011 (UTC) == Additional source == Hi, just a note for anyone interested, there is an additional source on ''Sao Paulo'' [http://books.google.com/books?id=0OwgqUnabYYC&pg=1064 here]. Thanks, [[User:The ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]] 00:32, 3 June 2013 (UTC) == Armor specification: conversion to metric system == The armor specification says: Turrets: 12–9–2/3 in (305–229–51/76 mm) 2/3 in is 16.93 mm. 51/76 mm is 0.671 mm. The problem is that 2/3 in (two-thirds of an inch) can't be converted to metric by converting both the numerator and the denominator: the latter should stay the same (as it is a ratio, not a measurement). 51 mm divided by 3 would give the correct (approx) 17 mm result. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/184.66.169.157|184.66.169.157]] ([[User talk:184.66.169.157|talk]]) 04:43, 17 April 2014 (UTC) :Hi there! The armor specification, as can be read in the [[Minas_Geraes-class_battleship#Specifications|Specifications]] section, is for two-to-three inches, not 2/3 of an inch. I've tried clarifying this in the infobox. Thanks very much, [[User:The ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]] 04:59, 17 April 2014 (UTC) Now it is unambiguous; thank you. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/184.66.169.157|184.66.169.157]] ([[User talk:184.66.169.157|talk]]) 05:03, 17 April 2014 (UTC)
